definition: A fundamental element or material that forms the basis of something, often used to describe the essential content or essence of a concept, theory, or substance. It is commonly employed in scientific, philosophical, or artistic contexts to refer to the underlying substance or matter that gives something its existence or significance.

examples.german: Die Substanz des Gebäudes ist sehr robust.
examples.english: The substance of the building is very sturdy.

examples.german: Die Substanz des Buches ist sehr informativ.
examples.english: The substance of the book is very informative.

examples.german: Die Substanz der Aussage ist zweifelhaft.
examples.english: The substance of the statement is questionable.

examples.german: Die Substanz des Medikaments ist gut verträglich.
examples.english: The substance of the medication is well-tolerated.

examples.german: Die Substanz des Stoffes ist chemisch stabil.
examples.english: The substance of the material is chemically stable.
